metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5090 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in KVM. An improper check in svm_set_x2apic_msr_interception() may allow direct access to host x2apic msrs when the guest resets its apic, potentially leading to a denial of service condition. Maxim Levitsky discovered that the KVM nested virtualization (SVM) implementation for AMD processors in the Linux kernel did not properly handle x2AVIC MSRs. An attacker in a guest VM could use this to cause a denial of service (host kernel crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5090` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-13-generic - 6.5.0-13.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic - 6.5.0-13.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic-64k - 6.5.0-13.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-aws - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1006-laptop - 6.5.0-1006.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-lowlatency - 6.5.0-13.13.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-13.13.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1012-oracle - 6.5.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1007-raspi - 6.5.0-1007.9
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-13-generic - 6.5.0-13.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic - 6.5.0-13.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic-64k - 6.5.0-13.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-aws - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-13.13').
linux-aws package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1010.10').
linux-azure package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
